gfx_panel
Class GfxPanel

java.lang.Object
  gfx_panel.GfxPanel

public class GfxPanel
extends java.lang.Object

A drawing panel that supports different shapes and many features like snapping.

Author:
Creative

Nested Class Summary
static class GfxPanel.Direction
          Direction, used in snapping and maybe othe stuff in the future.

GfxPanel

public GfxPanel(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell parent_shell,
                org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent,
                int width,
                int height)
Initializes the panel.

Parameters:
parent_shell - parent shell of the panel
parent - parent composite of the panel
width - panel's width
height - panel's height (must add 35 to the image's size)

Parameters:

Deleted a shape.

Parameters:

attachShapes

public void attachShapes(int attachedshape,
                         int mainshape)
Attaches the "attachedshape" to the "mainshape".

Parameters:
attachedshape - shape to be attached to the "mainshape", it will be moved with the main shape
mainshape - shape to attach to

deattachShapes

public void deattachShapes(int mainshape,
                           int attachedshape)
Detaches two shapes.

Parameters:
mainshape - main shape
attachedshape - attached shape to the main shape

deleteSelectedShape

public boolean deleteSelectedShape()
Deleted the selected shape.

Returns:
true: success, false: failure

getShapeArray

public java.util.ArrayList<Shape> getShapeArray()
Gets the collection of shapes.

Returns:
arraylist containing all the shapes on the panel
